intro: Acontias, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. Acontias species are typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. They have a compact growth habit and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance. The genus includes several species, such as Acontias maritima and Acontias acanthocarpa, which are adapted to harsh maritime climates.
